content.en: Algorithmic diagnosis: Researchers are exploring the use of algorithms to improve the diagnosis and treatment of primary aldosteronism (PA), a condition characterized by excessive production of the hormone aldosterone. They are investigating whether algorithms can be used to predict the subtype of PA based on factors such as computed tomography (CT) findings, serum potassium levels, and steroid profiling. Additionally, machine learning approaches are being developed to identify specific genetic mutations associated with PA and to predict clinical outcomes after surgery. These algorithms have the potential to enhance decision-making and improve patient care in the management of PA.
content.da: Algoritmisk diagnose: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer for at forbedre diagnosen og behandlingen af primær aldosteronisme (PA), en tilstand karakteriseret ved overdreven produktion af hormonet aldosteron. De undersøger, om algoritmer kan bruges til at forudsige subtypen af PA baseret på faktorer såsom fund fra computertomografi (CT), serumkalium-niveauer og steroidprofiler. Desuden udvikles der maskinlæringstilgange til at identificere specifikke genetiske mutationer forbundet med PA og til at forudsige kliniske resultater efter kirurgi. Disse algoritmer har potentiale til at forbedre beslutningstagning og forbedre patientpleje i håndteringen af PA.
